results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Search and Seizure;United States Politics and Government;Executive Privilege, Doctrine of;Trump, Donald J;Garland, Merrick B;Justice Department;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Federal Bureau of Investigation
results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Glenn Thrush
results.title: Trump’s Legal Jab Left Him Open to Justice Dept. Strike
results.abstract: A legal back-and-forth produced a straightforward narrative of how Mr. Trump and his lawyers repeatedly dodged the government’s attempts to recover sensitive documents for more than a year.

media.caption: The Justice Department used a routine court filing to disclose new evidence that former President Donald J. Trump and his legal team may have interfered with the inquiry.
media.copyright: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Courts and the Judiciary;Search and Seizure;United States Politics and Government;Executive Privilege, Doctrine of;Classified Information and State Secrets;Trump, Donald J;Cannon, Aileen M;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Justice Department;West Palm Beach (Fla)
results.byline: By Patricia Mazzei, Alan Feuer and Charlie Savage
results.title: Judge Keeps Door Open to Special Master in Trump Documents Inquiry
results.abstract: The federal judge in Florida also indicated that she would unseal a more detailed inventory of the materials seized in the search of the former president’s Mar-a-Lago home.

media.caption: The appointment of an independent arbiter is unlikely to derail the Justice Department’s inquiry into whether former President Donald J. Trump illegally held onto national security papers at his beachfront property.
media.copyright: Brittainy Newman for The New York Times

results.title: Charlbi Dean, Star of Top Winner at Cannes, Dies at 32
results.abstract: A South African-born actress and model, she had a breakout role in the satirical “Triangle of Sadness,” due in theaters in the fall.

media.caption: The model and actress Charlbi Dean, who starred in the film “Triangle of Sadness” and was a regular on the CW superhero series “Black Lightning.”

results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Ken Bensinger
results.title: Top Lawyer for Oath Keepers Is Arrested in Connection With Jan. 6 Attack
results.abstract: The lawyer, Kellye SoRelle, was charged with obstructing the certification of the 2020 election and tampering with evidence in the Justice Department’s investigation of the Capitol riot.

results.title: Bank of America Tests No-Down-Payment Mortgages in Black and Hispanic Neighborhoods
results.abstract: The pilot program aims to help first-time buyers in several neighborhoods obtain affordable loans.

media.caption: Bank of America said that eligibility for the program was based on income and location, and required no mortgage insurance.

results.title: The Pandemic Erased Two Decades of Progress in Math and Reading
results.abstract: The results of a national test showed just how devastating the last two years have been for 9-year-old schoolchildren, especially the most vulnerable.

results.title: In Seattle, It’s Almost Normal
results.abstract: The pandemic may have left some gaps in the urban fabric, but a neighborhood-by-neighborhood rundown of new restaurants and art events reveals that recovery is well underway.
